Calls to functions / class methods

Oftentimes, important actions are performed in calls to other functions or class methods. We can underline / highlight these calls and make them appear in the diagram by using the pattern //$ at the end of a code line. We could further distinguish when a certain action uses a call(s) or when this action is actually performed entirely within a call.

annotation

      //$ do something
      code line involving method 1   //$
      code line involving function 2  //$
      code line involving method 3
      
      //$1 do something inside the previous
      code line involving method 4
      //$ do next thing

Note: one should still be able to add a ‘normal’ comment (not belonging to the diagrams) after the //$ structure, with the syntax //comment

representation in the diagram

A click of the mouse will open the hyperlinks to the relevant function/method diagram.
